dynamicalSystems
Class Converter

java.lang.Object
  dynamicalSystems.Entity
      dynamicalSystems.Element
          dynamicalSystems.Converter

public class Converter
extends Element

A Converter is a auxiliary variable that holds some values that will be used by Flows and others Converters, along the time intervals

Author:
Wellington Bruno

Field Detail

asStock

protected boolean asStock
A converter usually is just a variable that holds its value at each time interval, without the need to know its last value. But sometimes, the Converter may act as a Stock,accumulating its value, depending on its last value.

In this moment, shall be used the Converter as stock

See Also:
setAsStock()

Converter

public Converter(java.lang.String name)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Constructs a Converter containing just a name,without a initial Value. In this case, the value will be zero.

connect

                    char type,
                    Entity b)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Connects two Entities with the default multipliers,and tells which is the relation between them.

Parameters:
a - The first entity to be used by the relationship
type - The type of relationship. Must be one of the available characters in Relationship
b - The second entity to be used by the relationship
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the type given is not a valid character.

To see the valid characters,

See Also:
Relationship#MAX}, Relationship#MIN}, Relationship#PRODUCT}, Relationship#DIVIDED}, Relationship#SUM}, Relationship#MINUS}

                    Entity a,
                    char type,
                    double fb,
                    Entity b)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Connects two Entities with the multipliers different than default,and tells which is the relation between them.

Parameters:
fa - The multiplier's value to the first Entity
a - The first Entity to be used by the relationship
type - The type of relationship. Must be one of the available characters in Relationship
fb - The multiplier's value to the second Entity
b - The second Entity to be used by the relationship
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the type given is not a valid character.

To see the valid characters:

See Also:
Relationship#DIVIDED},, Relationship#MAX},, Relationship#MIN},, Relationship#MINUS},, Relationship#PRODUCT},, Relationship#SUM}
